hello dong.

On 2014-07-09, 16:59 , Dong Liu edongliu@... [rest-discuss] wrote:
> I think when a use toggles,  s/he must do that based on what s/he sees
> or in fact saw. If it is a "blind" toggle then it is like the pull
> handle of a slot machine. And I agree with you and Mike for a POST in
> that case.

i don't think it matters anymore given that it seems a "blind toggle" is 
what is needed.

but if a "non-blind toggle" is needed, i think it simply would be 
confusing to even call it "toggle". in that case, you know the current 
state and want to switch to the other state, so why not just do that 
with the usual GET/PUT pattern?

cheers,

dret.
